Translations.Text: Would he then not know when has been exhumed whatever (was buried) in the graves
and stood fully received whatever (was stored hidden within the hearts) in the chests
Surely, their Nourisher-Sustainer about them, that Day (is) indeed Well-Acquainted (and All-Aware)
Al-Qariah (The great Calamity)
What is the great Calamity
And what made you realise what is the great Calamity
The Day mankind becomes like moths scattered about
And the mountains become like wool, fully carded
Then as for that: whose weights (of good deeds) became heavy —
so he will be in happy life in complete agreement (of the Will of God)
And as for that: whose weights (of good deeds) became light (and insignificant)
then his parent place will be Hawiyah
And what made you realise what it is, that one
(It is the) Fire extremely hot and fiercely blazing
An endeavour to excell others in acquiring (wealth and possessions of this world) has kept you involved —
until you visited the sites of burial (of your physical bodies or its remains)
By no means (it is of any benefit to you)! Soon you come to know (the consequences)
Again (I repeat)! By no means (it is of any benefit to you)! Soon you come to know
By no means! Would that you know the Knowledge of certainty
Indeed, you will notice the blazing Fire
Again! You shall indeed see it with an eye of certainty
Again! You shall be put to question that Day about the delights (and favour you enjoyed in your worldly life-span)
(Passage of) time (through the ages) acts as a witness
Verily, the human being is surely in loss
except those who have developed Faith and performed righteous deeds, and indulged in mutual teaching with Al-Haqq; and mutually prescribed to one another steadfastness (patience and perseverance)
Woe to every slanderer, backbiter
that who collected wealth and counted it
He thinks that his wealth made him last for ever. [‘made’ is the literal translation of the Arabic word. It stands for ‘would make’]
By no means! Indeed he will be cast in Al-Hutamatah
And what made you realise what Al-Hutamatah is
(It is the) Fire of Allah, kindled
that which leaps over the hearts
Surely, it shall be closed in on them (and made to cover and envelop them completely)
in (the form of) columns outstretched
Have you not noticed how your Nourisher-Sustainer dealt with the elephant-corps (the military contingent whose commander was on an elephant)
Did He not make their planning go in disarray
And directed towards them birds, in formation
(The birds) shoot them with stones out of sijjil [fully recorded (stock]
So (Allah) transformed them (into something) like fodder subjected to rumination
Under obligation to lelaf of Quraish
their lêlaf (travel documents to give protection) to the flight (movement of caravans) during winter and summer
so they must pay obedience to (the) Nourisher-Sustainer of this Al-Baiyt [The House (Ka‘ba at Makka)] —
to That (Allah) Who provided them food against hunger, and kept them safe against fear (of every lawlessness)
Have you watched him who denies the Accountability
So that is the one who harshly drives away Al-Yatim
And urges not for providing food to the indigent
Woe to those who offer Salat —
those: they are in error regarding their salat (canonical Prayer)
those: they (offer Prayers and only) act to be seen
and (also) reject (and refuse) Al-Ma‘un (small, routine requests from people around them)
Surely We, We bestowed you Al-Kauthar. ['The Abundance' (of good). This is an Attribute for Allah's Book. See

Therefore offer Salat devoted to your Nourisher-Sustainer; and take part in Nahr (‘piercing the chest with bayonets’ or ‘piercing a sharp, pointed cutting instrument in the carotid artery at the neck’)

Surely, the enemy charged with hatred towards you: he (is) put to rout, (and is) made extinct. [See article – 'The detailed format of the Scripture (Rabt-e-Suwar)' in Prolegomenon for discussion on Nahr
Say: “O you Al-Kafirun (Those who disbelieve Al-Kitab)
I do not obey whatever you worship
while you are not worshippers to That Whom I pay obedience
and I am not obedient to what you worshipped
while you are not worshippers to That Whom I pay obedience
To you (be) your way of life; and to me, my Religion (which comes from the Creator)
When has (already) come Aid (and Assistance) from Allah as well as the Victory (and success)
and you have seen mankind: they come to the fold of Allah’s Religion in troops
Then Glorify with Praise your Nourisher-Sustainer, and ask Him for forgiveness. Verily, He is Oft-Returning (with compassion)
Broke up the two hands of Abu Lahab [Father of the flame (of opposition; or the most furious opponent of Islam)] and he broke up (completely)
Did not benefit him his wealth and whatever he earned (through his concepts, beliefs and actions)
Very soon he reaches a Fire of (furious) flame
as well as his wife (being) a she-carrier for the wood-fuel (to further boost up the Fire)
In her neck (would be rolled) a twisted rope made of palm-fibre (which will help her drive to the site of Fire)
Declare: “He (is) Allah, (the) One
Allah, the Independent and Besought of all
He did not beget, and He has not been begotten
and did not become unto Him, equal in status — any one.”
Declare: “I seek refuge with Rabb of the day-break
against the evil-effect of that which He has created
and against the evil-effect of darkness when it has fully set
and against the evil-effect of those personalities who try to create sabotage in a commitment
and against the evil-effect of an envious when he envied.”
Declare: “I seek refuge with Rabb (Nourisher-Sustainer) of mankind
Malik (Sovereign-Ruler) of mankind
Ilah (God) of mankind
— against the evil-effect of one who whispers (but) hides himself
that who whispers in the chests of mankind
from amongst jinn and mankind.”
